title: How to Make Iraqi Baklava

parts.name: Making a Simple Syrup and Filling

steps.headline: Start with the simple syrup.
steps.description: Place equal amounts of both water and white sugar (1.5 cup) in stainless steel bowl. You may replace the simple syrup with honey.

steps.headline: Heat up the mixture and wait for the sugar to melt completely.
steps.description: Avoid rapid stirring because it may form sugar crystals in your syrup. Sugar crystals are disfavored because they can harden your syrup once it is cold.

steps.headline: Add 1 tablespoon  of concentrated lemon juice and 1 teaspoon of ground green cardamom.
steps.description: Let it boil for 10 minutes, and then set it aside and save it for later. Do not add the green cardamom and the lemon juice before sugar melts completely, because it may burn them and the flavor will be lost. You may also add vanilla or cinnamon.

steps.headline: Make the filling.
steps.description:
Blend together the following items until you have a grain-like mixture. Then set aside:
½ lb. green peanuts
1 tbsp. sugar
1 tbsp. ground green cardamom
½ cup of melted butter
2 tablespoons rose water

steps.headline: Mix together 2 cups of flour, 3 tablespoons of olive oil, and ½ a cup of water.
steps.description: Knead the dough until you have have created unified coherent dough. If this is your first time kneading a dough, there are some helpful tips and videos on how to knead a dough at How to Knead Dough.

steps.headline: Cut the dough into small, egg-sized portions.
steps.description: Then flatten it out into extremely thin sheets using dough sheet roller or you can skip this part by buying fillo dough from a grocery store.

steps.headline: Butter the two sides of each sheet.
steps.description: Then deposit half of them in tray.

steps.headline: Place the filling on top of the first half of the deposited layers.
Lay the rest of the sheets on top of the filling.
steps.description: The last sheet should be buttered heavily to make it extra crispy.

steps.headline: Cut the layers perpendicularly into small square pieces.
steps.description: Place the tray in the oven at 180 ̊C, for 35 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour the cold simple syrup in between the gaps.
steps.description: Then let it air dry for 2 hours. Air drying helps getting rid of the trapped water vapor. Avoid pouring extra syrup before air drying the Baklava, it may remove the crispiness.

steps.headline: Place the baklava on a serving plate.
steps.description: you may spray some of the saved filling powder on top, of the Baklava (If desired).

text:
Making a Simple Syrup and Filling Start with the simple syrup. Place equal amounts of both water and white sugar (1.5 cup) in stainless steel bowl. You may replace the simple syrup with honey. Heat up the mixture and wait for the sugar to melt completely. Avoid rapid stirring because it may form sugar crystals in your syrup. Sugar crystals are disfavored because they can harden your syrup once it is cold. Add 1 tablespoon  of concentrated lemon juice and 1 teaspoon of ground green cardamom. Let it boil for 10 minutes, and then set it aside and save it for later. Do not add the green cardamom and the lemon juice before sugar melts completely, because it may burn them and the flavor will be lost. You may also add vanilla or cinnamon. Make the filling. Blend together the following items until you have a grain-like mixture. Then set aside:
½ lb. green peanuts
1 tbsp. sugar
1 tbsp. ground green cardamom
½ cup of melted butter
2 tablespoons rose water Making the Dough Mix together 2 cups of flour, 3 tablespoons of olive oil, and ½ a cup of water. Knead the dough until you have have created unified coherent dough. If this is your first time kneading a dough, there are some helpful tips and videos on how to knead a dough at How to Knead Dough. Cut the dough into small, egg-sized portions. Then flatten it out into extremely thin sheets using dough sheet roller or you can skip this part by buying fillo dough from a grocery store. Filling and Baking the Baklava Butter the two sides of each sheet. Then deposit half of them in tray. Place the filling on top of the first half of the deposited layers.  Lay the rest of the sheets on top of the filling. The last sheet should be buttered heavily to make it extra crispy. Cut the layers perpendicularly into small square pieces. Place the tray in the oven at 180 ̊C, for 35 minutes. Pour the cold simple syrup in between the gaps. Then let it air dry for 2 hours. Air drying helps getting rid of the trapped water vapor. Avoid pouring extra syrup before air drying the Baklava, it may remove the crispiness. Place the baklava on a serving plate. you may spray some of the saved filling powder on top, of the Baklava (If desired).
